subject: p11022245
History: Status post AVR, assess left lung opacity.
Findings: Rounded bilateral mid lung opacities are again seen, grossly unchanged and likely reflect consolidative infectious process given history of septic emboli. There is unchanged bibasilar opacification, which is likely atelectasis with left greater than right effusions. Cardiac silhouette is markedly enlarged, similar to the most recent prior. Left PICC terminates in the cavoatrial junction. Median sternotomy wires are intact.
Impression: Unchanged bilateral mid lung opacities likely reflect infectious process given history of septic emboli. Unchanged or slightly increased left greater than right pleural effusion and associated atelectasis.
